newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Sabena says talking to Virgin on cargo.
newsitem.headline: Sabena says talking to Virgin on cargo.

text.p: Belgian flag carrier Sabena, 49.5 percent owned by Swissair, said on Monday it was talking to discount airline Virgin Express about cargo handling and catering facilities.

"Sabena, like everyone else, is talking to a lot of people about areas like cargo handling and catering...including Virgin," the spokesman said when asked to comment on a newspaper article on the possibility of the two doing a deal on flights.
"It is far to early to say if we are going to fly together to London," the spokesman said.
The Wall Street Journal said the two carriers, facing the full deregulation of European skies next April, were examining the possibility of sharing Sabena's routes to London.
This, it said would give Virgin Express a vital doorway to Britain and act as a useful feeder route for Sabena's longhaul flights from Brussels.
"I can neither confirm or deny the story," a Sabena spokesman said, adding that the airline had nine flights a day to London's Heathrow airport and four a day to London City airport.
